item.title: Git Worktrees: The Best Kept Git Secret?
item.description: What’s the Problem? Git branches are just a fact of life if you work on projects above a certain size: there’s just no other (good) way to scale and coordinate effort from multiple programmers on one codebase. Unfortunately, mandatory doesn’t mean always mean pleasant, and I’m sure most of you have danced the Branch Shuffle enough times that you know exactly what I’m talking about. What if I told you there was a better way?
